parse_proc module¶

Converts nested list/string representations to syntax trees built from Node’s.

parse_proc.parse(csn)¶

Converts a nested list/string representation into a syntax tree with C, S, and N nodes, establishing node links and threading.

Parameters

  • csn – Either a string (for N-nodes) or a list starting

  • nodes (with "C" or "S" followed by child) –

Returns

Root node of the constructed syntax tree

Return type

Node

parse_proc.parse_recurse(csn)¶

Called by parse.

Return type

Node

parse_proc.parse_thread(node)¶
Parameters

node (Node) –

parse_proc.tree_n_nodes(tree)¶

Return a list of N-nodes in preorder traversal order, one per unique lit value.

Parameters

tree (Node) – Root node of the parse tree

Returns

List of N-nodes, with only the first occurrence of each lit value

Return type

list[globals.Node]

parse_proc.tree_nodes(tree)¶

Return a list of all nodes in preorder traversal order.

Parameters

tree (Node) – Root node of the parse tree.

Returns

List of nodes in preorder traversal order.

Return type

list[globals.Node]
